description: Officials in Santa Rosa, a village in Moruca, Region One (Barima-Waini) have implemented a 14-day lockdown in the community in light of the increasing novel coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in the area.

Officials of Region Seven (Cuyuni-Mazaruni) have taken the step to implement more stringent measures to deal with and monitor the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) in the region. As of Tuesday, July 7, 2020, individuals seeking to pass through the Sherima Crossing, on the Essequibo River, will now be screened at the new Covid-19 checkpoint.
